name: typex
description: Enhanced version of the `type` builtin in POSIX-like shells that incorporates features from the `which` and `file` utilities.

scripts.preinstall: bash --version >/dev/null 2>&1 || printf '%s\n\n' "WARNING: bash not found; make sure it is installed before running this utility." >&2
scripts.install: printf '%s\n\n' "IMPORTANT: To install sourcing for supported shells, run typex -i"

author: Michael Klement <mklement0@gmail.com> (http://same2u.net)
